abstract: Sheik Ahmed bin Saeed Al-Maktoum, chairman of the Emirates Group, announced a $3.78 billion order for 54 Boeing 737-800 series jets, which he will use to start a low-fare airline, FlyDubai.
snippet: Sheik Ahmed bin Saeed Al-Maktoum, chairman of the Emirates Group, announced a $3.78 billion order for 54 Boeing 737-800 series jets, which he will use to start a low-fare airline, FlyDubai.
lead_paragraph: Leave it to the sheik to steal the show.

headline.main: Dubai Sheik Buys Boeing Jets for New Airline
headline.print_headline: Dubai Sheik Buys Boeing Jets for New Airline

abstract: Whatever the outcome of the reopened $35 billion competition for midair refueling tankers, there will be winners and losers on both sides of the Atlantic.
snippet: Whatever the outcome of the reopened $35 billion competition for midair refueling tankers, there will be winners and losers on both sides of the Atlantic.
lead_paragraph: FARNBOROUGH, England  Kensington Palace in London had been hired. The governor of Alabama was set to play host, the astronaut Buzz Aldrin was on the guest list and the leading European aerospace company was to be the toast of the evening.

headline.main: Air Tanker Contract Pits Airbus Against Boeing on Global Stage
headline.print_headline: Air Tanker Contract Pits Airbus Against Boeing on Global Stage

byline.original: By Caroline Brothers and Micheline Maynard
